situation: i had a break up with my partner.in this suitation i was very depressed and i faced lot of stress.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: How are you doing tonight?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: not so happy

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: In what way are you not happy? Can you elaborate?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i am not happy because of my current breakup with mypartner.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Problems often arise in relationships over misunderstanding each others point of view.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yeah i accept it there will be misunderstanding we want to get adjust

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: but it must be both side adjusted  ,if not it will result in breakup only.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I completely agree with you. One sided relationships do not work.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes it wont work at all

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What else besides unhappy do you feel about this breakup? Often there are a mix of emotions and looking at all of them is important to see the whole picture. People often report feeling relieved, regretful or other emotions with the feeling of unhappy.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: there is only thing for my depression is my break up i want to over come but i couldnot .

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What are some things that you enjoyed doing before this relationship?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i was going out for night pub ,enjoying with  friends

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Reaching out to old friends is a great idea to be able to regain some joy in life.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: but i cannot face them in this sutiation

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Many books have suggested that we are allowed to disclose what we want in relationships with friends. So if it is not something you wish to talk about with your friends tell them that and they should be willing to accept it. However I do understand if you do not want to reconnect with friends.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: they will accept me but i am not willing to share my negative mood with them.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand. What have you tried to overcome your depression?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i  am trying to overcome but i couldnot

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think what I meant are there things that you have done, that while you are doing them, you are not actively feeling depressed? Many people say that going for walks, taking a cooking class, starting a new hobby are ways they have stopped thinking about their depression and found some relief from it.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes this seems a good idea

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i will try  doing this things.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: In the past when I have dealt with depression following a breakup I have taken up a new hobby. I found I liked crochet. I made a blanket that I still have today.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i will try a new hobby are some other things.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is good to hear. Is there anything else you would like to talk about?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: nothing else is there

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It was nice talking to you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i think this enough for me to overcome my depression.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thank you for the suggestion

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It is a good place to start.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thank you so much

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: it is good talking to you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: bye

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: bye

supporter_question1: I like to help people with their problems

situation: My significant other has started to become distant and I fear our relationship is over.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hi, how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello. I suppose I could be doing better.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Anything in particular you're having a hard time with?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yep. Thanks for asking. It feels to me like my GF and I may be breaking up.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm sorry, I've been in that position before. Do you feel it's for the best?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No. I am very sad about it. She recently informed me shes going to go a graduate school far away after I made the decision to come to school near where she lives.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's really hard, especially when there's chance it could have worked out if it wasn't for the distance. Do you regret choosing to go to the school near where she lives?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes. I feel like I put my life on hold for someone else only to have them throw me to the curve.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Definitely feeling like you're living for someone else and having them not do the same is hurtful. Although it seems like you're the one in the relationship who is willing to make more sacrifices

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: At this point, yes.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just wish we would of talked about this a year ago when I uprooted my life the first time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I fear that this will continue to happen.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh ok then it's not the first time this has happened.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think you might be right, if you notice a pattern then it might continue to happen

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: So you think this will continue to happen?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Most likely, she seems to need space to live for herself and is less willing to make sacrifices for you like you do for her

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: But even it won't happen again, you shouldn't have to live worrying that it will

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you spoken to her about how you feel?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I dont even know how to start the conversation.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel betrayed and that I have wasted the last 3 years.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Wow I can only imagine. But I think it wasn't a waste if there were good times and you had room to grow. In relationships you have to prioritize your own happiness and I'm sure if you mentioned that you're frustrated and hurt maybe you can understand how she feels and why she made the decisions she made

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Its frustrating. I am sorry to complain. It seems silly with everything going on in the world.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Absolutely not! Individual frustrations are the best things to focus on before everything that happens in the world.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: What should I do? I feel like I just need to give up. I feel even worse because it is Christmas.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think it's important that you talk to her and get the answers you need. She might not even have been aware you feel this way and assumed you were happy to move for her.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Although again, I'm really sorry you have to go through this during the holidays, definitely sucks but doesn't mean you can't at least get some answers and move on with your life

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Thank you for talking to me! I hope it all works out

situation: My kids are driving me crazy now that we are all having to work and school our kids from home. My husband and I both work from home now because of Corona. They are going crazy since the emergence of the Corona Virus.

dialog.content: I hear you but....

dialog.content: Try to talk to them and be very firm with them

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
I'm so glad the vaccine is here
\

dialog.content: Thats a better idea....

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.content: I appreciate your support and maybe I will take them to the park where we all play family games but just with us four. They really love to do that. I think that they want attention from us more because we are right here.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Or maybe we'll have a picnic together.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It has been awhile since we have done something outside of the house together.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes maybe that will work for them and probably want to be outside

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel it is like pent up frustration. They were very very busy before Corona

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: are they having a good Christmas

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: They are SUPER happy today of course. Luckily they have received the same amount of presents they get any other Christmas because our income has stayed the same. These kids do not know how lucky they are right now. Maybe I can stress that to them a well. They need to know they have a lot to be grateful for.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks for your ear and your help! I hope you have an awesome christmas and please stay safe!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Right i understand that. Just talk to them and be firm with them that will get them to listen more.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Your welcome. Have a awesome Christmas to and stay safe to.

situation: I had to throw out my 13 year old sister.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello, how are you at the moment? My name is Jo

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am doing okay I suppose.. How are you??

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am not so bad. Is there anything you'd like to talk to me about today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes. I had to throw out my sister the other day and Im kind of upset over it.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that. What precipitated that, had you been having problems for a while?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: She was in a psych ward for a while and when it was time to discharge her, my mother didnt want her back. She was going to send her to a foster home so I volunteered to take her in.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Since then, she has stopped taking her medication and is acting out.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Ah, so you feel as though your mother could and should have helped and you were put into an impossible position you were not prepared for?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Pretty much.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can sympathise with you having siblings with extreme mental health problems - I have been there too and I know how difficult it is.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I tried to have  my mother take her back, but she still didnt want her there. So I sent her to my grandmothers and she turned that side of the family against me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Mentally ill people can unfortunately sometimes be manipulative, though they do not mean it. Have you had any contact with her since?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Only once and she was just telling me that I was a horrible person.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: This all started over her stopping her meds and then I asked her to clean her room.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That sounds very toxic. Is it possible to persuade her to seek medical help? I realise she might be reluctant to

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: We have tried to get her into therapy again. But, COVID put a block on that.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I suggested that she go back to the ward and maybe be placed into a group home.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Ah yes, it is a terrible time at the moment isn't it? I think a lot of people are not getting the medical help that they need because of the virus

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Please do not beat yourself up over this - it does sound as though you have done absolutely everything you could to help.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I would hate to see that happen, but Im at my wits end.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can tell that you feel really bad about this just from your  tone of voice. Please remember that you can't fix everything in the world.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Now my dads side of the family hates me because they say Im "mean to her". All I asked her to do was to clean her room and maybe socialize every once in a while.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Im more mad than sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Socialising can be hard for people with mental health problems. It might have been best if you did not press her too hard to do that though I know you did not realise.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I understand, but I think it would have better than sitting in a dark room all day.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Does she suffer from depression also? That might account for her trying to shut herself away

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, but she denies it whole heartedly.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: This is why she was taking medication.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand that it can be very difficult to make people take medication if they refuse to recognise that they have a problem.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just wish she could she what I see...

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Unfortunately that is not likely to be possible. All you can do is be kind to yourself and know that you really did try to help her

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I was afraid she was going to ruin my family with her attitudes.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I hope that I have been able to help a little. I really appreciate that you felt that you could open up to me

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you. I feel better being able to rant to someone.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You're welcome. Have a lovely festive season! I feel that all will be better in the coming year.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You need to press quit from your end and take the survey :)

situation: I wanted to start having sex with other women from the Internet and my wife would not allow it.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello! Is there anything that you want to talk about today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I need someone to talk to, I am sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I really love my wife, but I also like other women.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Ah - so I hear you saying you are tempted to be unfaithful to your marriage vows?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes.  I tried to see if she would let me sleep with other women from the Internet, and she is not allowing it.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Well I must say that as a woman I would not allow it either ;)

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes I would agree with that.  I guess I wanted my cake and be able to eat it too.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It does sound like it. Are there any other problems in your marriage that might be making you unhappy or is it generally okay and you just want someone else too?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am trying to get my wife to spice up our love-making and she is unwilling to do so, and that makes me super sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you considered getting some sort of marriage guidance counselling? There are people out there who might be able to help you both

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Why would we need counseling to spice up a love life?  That should come naturally, is it hard for women to make that change?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think it sounds as though you might be pushing her into things she is not ready for though. Have you considered that you might be the problem?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That is what makes me sad, I know I am the problem.  I am a piece of trash, she is way better than me.    I hate myself.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: No, I do not think you should say that! At least you recognise that you are not behaving well, which is the first step on the road to making things better.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Maybe I have a sex addiction.  I think I watch too much pornography and it gives me weird ideas for sex.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Perhaps you could consider individual counselling to overcome your own problems before you think of couples' therapy?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Porn can be helpful for a relationship but it can also be damaging.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Just for me?  I hope I get a male counselor because if it was a female one, I would probably want to sleep with her.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Well, perhaps it would be better for you to learn that you can't just do that even though you want to :)

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, I can't control my impulses.  I am picturing what you look like now and imagining what we would do together.  I think I have a big problem.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am forty five, fat and married :). I do recommend talking to someone though.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am forty one, fat and married.  I actually prefer heavier ladies, but I get your point.  :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am glad you were able to confide a little in me and hope it is the first step on the road to a happier marriage. I do recommend not giving into your urges and remembering how much you love your wife. I wish you all the best for the future and have a lovely Christmas!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks, you too.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: (you need to end the conversation from your end - I can't )

situation: My marriage of 10 years is currently failing.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: How are you today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Really bad. My 10 year marriage is failing. Things have not gotten better.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What happened?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's the thing. Nothing really happened. No cheating, drugs, or abuse. I suppose the euphoria has worn off, and she just doesn't find me interesting anymore.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand how you feel. Have you guys tried spending more time with each other? Maybe going out on dates?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Maybe we haven't done this enough in the past. We both had busy careers. I tried initiating this last year, but without success. Maybe, I was too late.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Its never too late to put spice back into the relationship.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I hope you're right. Do you have other suggestions about how to do so?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Show her that your still love because by being spontaneous. Surprise her with gifts. Maybe take her on a random vacation somewhere. Have a deep conversation about how you are feeling and that you still love her and want her in your life.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It might take a little bit but its better to try than not to try at all.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think your suggestions are very helpful. A vacation is currently out of the picture due to COVID. I want to try having deep conversations, but I don't know where to start.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Start by talking about whats going on. Tell her how you think you guys should spend more time with her. Or that you dont want to lose her. Ask her if there is anything she might want to discuss. She maybe having issues shes afraid to talk about.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think you hit upon something. She is quite hesitant in talking about issues. Do you have any thoughts about marriage counselling? We've never tried that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think that would be a good idea. Having the chance to get things out and getting more advice is always helpful. Make sure you leave any issues at common ground.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: If my wife is the one having issues with conversations, do you think a male or female therapist/counsellor would be better? I want her to feel comfortable expressing herself.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Most likely a female therapist would be better. Nobody understands a woman more than a woman.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think that sounds like a safer choice. I was also hoping if you have suggestions for me personally. I am quite depressed and I am having problems getting through the day.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I suggest taking one step at a time. I wouldn't rush through things. I would suggest sitting down and talking through some things that are going on. Maybe taking some time away from work. Going out and spending time with each other as much as you can.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If you guys think you may need a marriage counselor, I highly recommend it. I think it would be a great start.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you very much for your response. You have been very helpful. Perhaps, one last question - my wife and I have been hiding our problems away from our teen-age son. Do you agree that we should continue to keep it from him?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Depending on the nature, I think you should let him know whats going on. He may already know.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Ok, thanks for all your help again. I feel much better now, and hopefully I will get through this.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I know its really hard, but I think you guys with work things out. Have hope. Times are stressful, especially in this day and age.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Take care, friend, good-bye

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: goodbye

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: 9 to 11 would exhaust me. That is 14 hours?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yeah - something like that. and lunches are at the desk - as i am working from home - so its pretty much no breaks either.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would certainly agree with you. That kind of work is unsustainable. Let me ask you this. What would happen if you told your employer you simply could not do these hours?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: hah - i dunno. im on a team of 2 people - and i guess if i dont do it, the other person has to. or it just doesnt get done, and i dont know what happens?? nothing? LOL.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: The worst that could happen is that they fire you. But that doesn't seem too likely as they seem to need you. But I have learned in life that if I don't care for myself, hardly anyone does. We need to be kind to ourselves. Set boundaries.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: agreed - i dont think they would fire me, maybe get reprimanded or more likely a guilt trip as to why I cant do it. Im just not sure what kind of boundaries I set when we have things due, and just literally no time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Setting boundaries can be difficult if you haven't done that a lot. When we think we don't have the ability to say NO, then we feel trapped, worn out, depressed, taken advantage of. People need to know that we reasonably can say no.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, I have to set boundaries, because working till 11pm most nights is not sustainable. and who on earth is going to view, let alone sign a contract at 12am

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think that would be the first step. Determine how many hours you feel you COULD work. Then advise them that is what you will do. Find out what kind of timelines there are, and if you can't do it, don't go beyond your boundaries. It is obviously destroying your life. It really isn't healthy for you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Exactly. It isn't working for you. Something has to change. And you sound intelligent, so you can determine what will work for you -- perhaps a range of hours, but definitely not 14 hours. Unless you are a young kid. lol Even then, that's a lot.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yeah - ill come up with reasonable boundaries till 5:30 is reasonable, and if its a do or die situation cap it at 7:30 --- and thats only for dire situations. if that doesnt work, well then i guess either i dont have a job, or people figure out how to work in regular hours.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That sounds reasonable to me. And if they try to make you feel guilty, reject that. Tell them, I'm sorry, but I feel this is reasonable, and truly it is.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: hah i used to go out like a young kid, but still - just because most of us are working from home 24/7, doesnt mean I actually can work 24/7. even fi i were young, hell no. they dont pay me enough.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thanks i really appreciate it. it sounds reasonable, and its what a coworker told me. if i dont set boundaries, i will crack.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: No one can work 24/7.  I think they may not even be aware you are struggling. So communication is important.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You don't want to crack. It's not worth it.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yeah, i think a call to not just my boss is in order, but also HR to advise them of the situation. they need to start telling managers, we are NOT front of the line workers, nor police, fire, etc. our jobs are not THAT important.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I will say a prayer that you communicate your needs politely but firmly. And not believe false guilt. As you said, you aren't putting out fires and doing CPR.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: plus netflix, hulu, amazon keep releasing new shows. if i need a reason, it can simply be to watch tv and detox (so to speak) and get away from the BS of work (obv stating it more nicely than that).

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: This has been a stressful year for many of us, you don't need to be working yourself into depression and exhaustion.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You really do not NEED a reason not to work unreasonable hours.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: agreed 100% --- ive already hit those points, and it is not good for anyone let alone my job.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It isn't anyone's business what you do on your off hours.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: completely agreed! and thanks for listening  :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I do suggest you simply stick to the facts. These are the hours, I can't work more.  You don't need to explain that to anyone. But be firm and polite. And you are very welcome. Sometimes we just need a friend! :D

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: its what i needed to hear from someone who is more anonymous (so to speak). who doesnt have a first hand attachment to me, so its a great assessment.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I've been in that boat before. It isn't easy, but I learned what I had to do, and I don't get in that boat anymore. And I can see to help others get out.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
:-)
firm and direct is the best approach. esp for my boss. she will appreciate that and then i will stick to what i say!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Amen!  GREAT!  I'm glad to hear it!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: cheers! take care and have a great day. if you dont do this in your day job, you should consider it. or at least i get the feeling youre there for others

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Thank you! I'm retired but do community work! :D Am considering getting an office. I do love to encourage! YOu have a blessed day!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Can you try talking to someone?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Family? My family kicked me out of their own house 3 years ago. I am nothing but a burden for them. They would just appreciate if I died.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What about close friends, or people you care about? I am sure they would not want to lose you.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.content: Are overdoses painful?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I care

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I doubt you do. You are just getting paid to be here.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Just from chatting with you, I can feel how sad you are about life and maybe a little overwhelmed with what the next step of life is.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I used to be really sad about life too. However, helping others who are sad helped me become happier, knowing that I am helping others also become happier.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I believe no one is useless. We were all brought on this earth for a reason.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's a very optimistic view...

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

situation: I fear that I might never be loved again. I feel so lonely.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello. How are you feeling today?

dialog.content: Hi. I'm feeling okayish.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It sounds like there maybe something you need to get off of your chest.

dialog.content: Absolutely. I recently broke up with my girlfriend. We had been together for more than 3 years.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What happened that made you guys break up?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: She said that she simply wasn't in love anymore, and that she didn't have the same feelings she did at the beginning.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have also had this situation happen to me. Maybe it just wasn't the right timing or she had other interests.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: She was so important for me. I feel so empty.... I Feel like I'm never finding anyone like her ever again,

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: The first step of a break should be to starting loving thyself. If you get out there and find hobbies you enjoy, who knows, you may find someone that will love you more than you could imagine. Take it from me, I've had this happen. Sitting around sulking about it is only going to delay things in your life.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It's easier said than done. At times I would rather maybe just dissapear. I have never had anyone else show romantic interest in me before.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What is your age?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am 25 at the moment.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You still have your whole life ahead of you. Some people don't find a partner until their 40's or even 50's. When I left my ex I found this guy that I truly fell in love with. He is still sulking in his living room. I told him that if he didn't move one that he wouldnt get anywhere in life. I told him that if he cared about me, he would move on because thats truly what I would want him to do and I think thats what your girl would want you to do as well.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I disagree with you regarding that maybe that is what she wants me to do. I don't think she cares about me at the slightest anymore. I was a burden for her and will probably keep being it for any woman I meet.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Did she give you any reasons to why she wasn't in love anymore?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think she wasn't feeling physically attracted to me anymore.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Did you ever think she maybe possibly has been cheating?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I could not say for sure.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But I surely think she wouldn't cheat on me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Has she ever tried to hide text messages, lock her phone, or tell you she is too busy to come over?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, In the past few months she has kinda freaked out everytime I tried to get her phone for her

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: As if she didn't want me to see something

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Im sorry that this stressful for you. In my past, I have had exes do that to me. Most likely she was cheating on you and this was the reason for her motives.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I can't believe she would do something like that... I really need to confront her about it. I can't have this doubt on my chest.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would definitely confront her about it. I wouldn't get angry or fight about it. Maybe she if she has a new boyfriend already. That is a really good indicator.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You are right. I need to take this slowly and calmly.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would calmly ask her. She will most likely deny it. But, some ofher friends may already know about this. If she says she did, ask her if there was something you did wrongthat made her do it. Sometimes its not even the Cheatee. Sometimes they just do it for no good reason.

situation: I am depressed and always angry. I lose my temper and say racist things to people, and am miserable to be around. dialog.content: I am always angry at myself and others. I lose my temper constantly and say very racist things.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.content: Where does your anger stem from ?

dialog.content: I think it is because people disagree with my politics.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am sick of being discriminated against because of my skin color.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Its ok to disagree with people about topics but you need to figure out why it triggers so much anger which turns to hate

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Half my family is Puerto Rican, I am White. All the Puerto Rican family members consider themselves to be allies of the blacks, I do not. I have been repeatedly victimized by black people,

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: How have you been victimized by black people? When those events happen how did that make you feel

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have been robbed at gunpoint three times in the past 8 months while walking home from work. Each time, it was one or more black males with guns who robbed me. They would call me racial slurs every time too.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Also, my wife was raped by a black homeless man in July 2020 while she was jogging in the park. This made me get so angry, that I burned down a low-income housing building that was occupied by only black residents. I tried to get even with the blacks for what happened to my wife.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I can't seek help with a professional for my anger issues, because I have committed violent crimes to get even with my oppressors.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Are you going to help me?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content:
I see I too have had my issues with other races. A few bad instances do not make represent a whole race though. There are also black males who have been robbed and jumped by white people that does not mean all white males are bad. It does seem that you have had alot of unfortunate events with black males. That still does not mean that all black people are bad and why should innocent people pay for things others have done. Do
 you have to walk home from work or can you drive. Also have you reported any of these events to the police.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I walk home because my job is only a mile away. I live in a predominantly black area. The police have taken reports, but candidly admitted to me that nothing would happen as far as arrests because of the current "woke" climate.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand have you ever thought about if that black man that raped your wife was just getting even with the white race because his wife or maybe even him was raped repeatedly by white supremists

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It upsets me, the way I feel. I do have 2 or 3 black neighbors who are decent people, but thats it. I am the only White person on my street. I am constantly taunted by the blacks in my area.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No black woman has been raped by a white man in recent history, even DOJ crime statistics back me up on this one. When is the last time anyone remembers a pack of white men raping a black lady?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just want to not be scared around here anymore. I am sick of being victimized. They are pushing me over the edge.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: My suggestion would be to get out of the area if is just triggering your anger. Are you able to move to another area?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I can move, but it would be very costly. And I don't want to move now because it is winter and it is cold and we have over a foot of snow on the ground.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would suggest for your mental health when the weather is better to move and until then I would avoid areas that can potentially be dangerous and also don't walk home after dark. Also you need to keep seeking council for you anger and racial feelings. I would suggest when you feel very angry to take a deep breath think will your actions help or hurt the situation.  To help with racial issues I would like you to sit and talk to black victims who have been victimized by white people in violent crimes.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I appreciate this advice. It does seem good. I just want everything to get better.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If you follow my advice I think you will see a great improvement. Your willingness to seek advice and ability to identify that you have a problem is a big first step all you got to do now is put the solutions into practice.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Do you think that maybe I should go to church or something to help?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Church is always a great idea. I think church would be very helpful. Maybe someday you should even consider going to a predominantly black church.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I would consider it. There is actually a black church 3 or 4 blocks from here. The people there are undoubtedly as nice as anybody else im sure.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Maybe you should try it out maybe meeting some good black people there would ease your hate against black people and also help your experience in the neighborhood.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you. You have been helpful

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is what I'm here for. If you ever need anything else don't hesitate to reach out and good luck. I know you are going to do great and be just fine.

dialog.content: Well, I moved to a new state - feeling pretty alone.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If you feel a little out of your depth, that is perfectly normal at this stage!

dialog.content: I feel like I know what the right things to do are, but nothing sounds fun. I feel like I'm just trying to force myself to do the things I should want to do.

dialog.content: It sounds to me like you might be suffering from depression. A lot of the population have this problem! Do you think that this might be the case?

dialog.content: If I could have traded places with one of my parents, I would have in a heartbeat. They loved life, and they were good at it.

dialog.content: So you feel that you are bad at life? Please do not!

situation: I broke up with my partner last month and I'm in a funk

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello. How are you tonight?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm hanging in there. I'm in a funk.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm sorry to hear things aren't going to well. What's the problem in a nutshell?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I split with my girlfriend after 5 years together last month/

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Breakups can be hard, I can understand your frustration. Five years is a long time to have a relationship and then end.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I caught her cheating on me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm sorry to hear that. That's hard to forgive and move on from that.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm trying to just move on but I feel so insulted. I'm mad then sad back and forth, over and over.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I find that when I have a very painful situation, I try to only thing about it for a certain amount of time. Then I make a list of things to do so I can be occupied to not think about it.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, but my whole life was upended. My living situation, my friend circle is broken up over this. I don't know how to move on. Any suggestions?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Getting over a breakup will take time? Have you ever heard of DABDA? Denial (I can't believe this happened!) Anger (we all know that) Bargaining (If only I had done that, or if only - trying to make it FEEL better by imagining other scenarios - doesn't really work) Depression - sadness, then Acceptance -- we go in and out of these emotions and sometimes it can make us feel crazy, but all of them are normal in varying degrees and we don't know when they will happen.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, but those sound like the typical stages of grief. I guess I'm in anger. I have no interest in barbagining.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would make a list of things you have always wanted to do and then just BRAINSTORM any idea, no idea is too out there -- learn to ice skate, learn to play the ukulele, sign up for dance lessons, join the gym, go to a singles group at church, visit the elderly, volunteer somewhere.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think I need to focus on exercise. Just get my body and mind healthy and full of energy. What do you think?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I also find it helpful not only to limit how much I dwell on my pain, but make sure I reach out to help someone else. I will tell you, that is the secret to happiness. Maybe help a neighbor with groceries or hanging lights. Old people (me) love help, bake something or call your aunt or uncle.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: True, but it's hard not to dwell. It's not like I have a choice. It overcomes me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I agree, get healthy and try to help others. One thing about feelings is that if you change your mind, you can change your feelings, it might happen slowly, but if you put your mind off of it, it will help. Not saying NEVER feel the emotions, but feelings are the tail of the dog, not the dog itself, You do not have to be ruled by them. You don not have to FEEL like going for a walk to go for a walk.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It's hard not to just drown myself in booze and cannabis.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: A healthy balance of self care, and other centered behavior and know this will take time. I just takes time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Time heals all wounds for sure

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand, but those are choices that really, long term, are not for your benefit. Her cheating was a reflection on HER bad character, not yours. You have to love yourself and try to fight this.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Are you Ai or a human mturker?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm a human. I live in KY, retired counselor! hhahaha I prayed for someone to encourage.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: OH cool. Well your prayer came true. I'm, also a human....from Georgia

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm from the city, so there isn't much to do on a farm in the middle of cold weather. I have been through a lot of breakups, so I know what works, and yes, I was cheated on, devastating. But you can overcome this. Make that list and do NOT let your feelings rule your life. You can recover and find someone worthy of your love and care.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks so much!!! I really appreciate it! :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: The WORST breakup came a year before I met my husband. in retrospect, it was the best thing, listen,you could have married this girl, count your blessings. cheating is just terribly destructive. And you are welcome. Take care of yourself. Write the list of goals and fun things to do, choose one every day.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You are very kind! All the best!! Take care!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Bye now! God bless!

situation: This pandemic has me depressed everyday and the drugs are not helping, before something else happens to me or I do something stupid, help.....

dialog.content: I see, have you just started them?

Yes, I have told my doctor my concerns and he mentioned this portal to go talk to someone without a face to get a broader view on your problems. This method has been working for a lot of his patients
 so far.

dialog.speaker: supporter

situation: trapped in a house with my brother which i can not afford to get out of.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is living with your brother a bad thing? What specifically is making you upset?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes it is. he acts like a azz most of the time. he dosent care about anyone but himself. just like his fianc. he throws away the bills and expects me to pay to keep the utilities on when they are about to be disconnected. then tells me i dont contribute to the house.

dialog.content: It seems like he would be a very difficult person to live with. And that is hard for you obviously. I'm thinking your upset because you can't leave so you're stuck. Is that correct?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What have you done to try and help the situation?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: trying to, looking for every way possible to make money and save it up and move out. really dont want to have to partition the property as its the house we grew up in.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would feel the same way if that's a house I grew up in. I'm so sorry!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i tried to talk to him, in his mind its all my fault he cant pay the bills he had before i moved in. i had been living in california for the last few years, but came back with corona virus on the rise there.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If he's in a certain mindset, it would be hard to change that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you have people to talk to about this? It sounds like a lot to handle.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: right? and his fianc is the same way, they are both alcoholics and spend most  of their income on their habits. its all i can do right now to keep food in the house, let alone running water.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think it would be good for you to talk to someone and get help.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Right now, all you can do is keep chugging along and trying your best to stay afloat.

dialog.content: i have a couple of friends that i have talked to about it, but it just seems like i am screaming at a brick wall and nothing changes.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Talking with them can help you figure out what you should do.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: is it normal to always feel helpless? cause thats how its been. either rip everything to shreds or do nothing.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes it is. Especially now. I just want to encourage to keep pushing. Think about yourself in a year or two from now. Do everything you can right now to get out of the situation. If it gets really bad, don't be afraid to call out for help (like the police). Stay safe and do what's best for you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You've got this!

dialog.content: police are a very bad idea where i live. they will not prosecute family violence without also prosecuting me. i live in texas, if i press charges, the state will press charges against me. i have several scars from incidents where they told me as such. its really a loosing battle where the law is concerned here.

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter

situation: My partner left me for another woman after fifteen years and after saying he did not want children with me.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi there, I badly need someone to talk with!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: hi whats on your mind today

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My partner left me after fifteen years and I simply do not know what to do.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: wow. that had to come as a shock. when did you find out

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Things had not been going well for a while but I had not realised just how bad it would be.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: i'm so sorry to hear that. how long ago did they leave?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: About two weeks. I have barely left the house since then. I just do not feel that I can go on.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: not leaving the house is the new normal for many of us right now. are you not leaving because you have nowhere to go or because you are feeling bad

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think mostly the latter. I just do not want to face the world any more . I feel that everyone must know that I've been dumped and be laughing at me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: you havve already made it two weeks by going one day at a time

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I did not really have any choice though .  I do not see any future for myself now that we are separated.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: do you know brene brown and her work

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No I do not, who is that?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: she studies vuneraility and shame. please look for her TED talk and there's a great youtube video on empathy

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you , I will. Right now I really need some sort of emotional support. I feel that the last fifteen years of my life have been a waste.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: i bring her up because what i sounds like is that you are feeling embarrassed because your partner made a choice that wasn't you

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: in reality the choice they made wasn't about you, it was about them

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It is not so much that - it is that I feel that I dedicated the majority of my adult life to this relationship and now there is nothing left.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: you are left and you are enough. even if you dont feel like it right now you are enough

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I really do not feel like it right now. What was the last fifteen years all about? I wanted to have children with him and he refused but now I hear he is expecting a baby with another woman.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: a relationship is part of who you are. it isn't you

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But it is very difficult to try to strike out on my own again and I do not know if I even want to.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: it is hard. it sucks. but the voyage through the suck is going to be better for you than you may realize right now

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But I feel that I am facing middle age on my own and I really do not want to do that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: you have survived 14 days without a bad relationship. keep on doing that day by day and before you know it, you will be on the other side of the bad feelings

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: What happens if I just can't ever get over it though? Right now it's hard to see any sort of way through these feelings.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: yes, middle age is scary, but there are so many things you can do. ageism is out

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel I might have missed out on my chance to have a family of my own though, because I waited fifteen years and my partner would not go for that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: please watch the cartoon animals and brene brown on youtube talk about empathy. find one of your friends who has been through the suck and let them help you find your path out.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Most of my friends seem to be very happily coupled up right now. They are sympathetic but they do not really understand.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: i had an emergency ovary removal in my early 30s and didn't know if i woudl be able to have children. my doctor told me that the most important thing i could do was to be healthy becuse a healthy mother was what i could give my children even if i adopted them

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That sounds like very good advice from both you and your doctor. It is a difficult thing to have to confront though. I really do appreciate the fact that you have taken the time to talk honestly with me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: you want an empathetic friend. nobody has gone through the exact same thing you have but the emotions are common ones. you will be ok, even if you dont feel that way now

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I hope that I will but am not sure. I really do feel rather better about things now though but - there's a long way to go. Thank you so much for your support!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: stay strong and stay safe

situation: I have been getting low grades lately and am scared I will be thrown out of my University.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi there, could you please give me some advice?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello, would you like to explain your situation and we can go through  it together

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel that I am blowing my future because I am just not scoring well on tests these days. I just don't feel motivated to work as hard as I know that I should.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: So you don't feel motivated and you are not scoring well, have I understood that correctly?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes. I know that the two things are probably related but I just do not know what to do about them.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What are you currently studying?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am studying microbiology. I do not know that I have the passion for it that I once did though.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Your motivation and how you are studying is probably related, you are right. What attracted you to microbiology in the first place?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have always found it fascinating and have an uncle who is a microbiologist. But these days I feel I made the wrong decision. Is it too late to change?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It is never too late to change anything. However, i hear that you have always found it fascinating,have you considered talking to your uncle and seeing if you can find what you loved about it again?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes that does sound like good advice. I do not want to turn by back on my studies of the past years. But my grades are really poor and I am not sure what to do about that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Studying can be really difficult , especially when you are half way through. i struggled in my studies and found that talking to my tutors helped and approaching student support. Have you tried anything like that or has your motivation held you back?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: To be honest I have been a little afraid to approach them about the subject because they might accuse me of just slacking. I know it might look like that from the outside.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Just from chatting to you, I can sense that you are anxious, however, as many students feel this way, they will have a whole lot of help they can provide.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I do feel that part of my problem is that I am afraid to really open up about it. You are the first person I have really felt able to talk to.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am pleased that you have been able to open up to me, it is the first step towards you finding your path. Do you find it easy to write things down?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, it is really much more easy to write my problems down than to actually talk to people about them face to face.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: One suggestion is for you to write down all the reasons that you love microbiology. It can be any format, I love a bubble chart (mind map), it could be in list form or just doodles, would this be something you would find useful?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, that is a fantastic idea! Maybe I can find a renewed interest in the subject. I hope that I can because I really do not want my time studying to have been wasted.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It would be a really good place to start. Then you could be really kind to yourself and take some pressure off. Would you like to talk through some ideas to help with the work itself?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes I really would. I already feel more motivated! Half an hour ago I felt that I had no place left to go and felt defeated.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's really good, sometimes it is about finding a direction and small steps. Often when we are studying the work seems really big, especially essay questions. One thing that helped me was to break it into really small chunks, sometimes physically covering up some of the question. Would that be something that would help?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have not really tried it but I ought to. I often feel that I am just overwhelmed. Then I know that I got something wrong for definite and I just want to give up.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It could be something you can try, remember , it is not always about ought to, simply how can I make it easier for myself. It is okay to get things wrong too. situation: I have found out that my friends have been socialising behind my back without me. This makes me very sad.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi there, are you free to talk? I am feeling rather sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hi there. Yes, What is making you sad?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I feel that my friends do not like me very much any more. Apparently they have been engaging in group activities without me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand how frustrating that can be to not be part of the group activities.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Do you think that I am over-reacting? I do not want to sound over sensitive but this has been happening for a while.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you talked with your friends on how you feel? When was the last time you all connected?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: We went out for coffee the other day and I thought about saying something cos I know they went to a club without me last weekend but I couldn't bring myself to in the end.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand it is tough to bring up what is bothering you, especially after getting to hang out with all your friend over coffee. I'm sure this was not intentional with not inviting you to the club.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Sometimes in the past I have turned down invitations to go out clubbing, admittedly. Could it be that they just did not think that I wanted to go?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: From what I have experienced personally, I am not a fan of clubs and didnt want to go with my friends. After turning them down a few times, they stopped inviting as well. I think they thought that was not my thing.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: The thing is though that this is not the only thing - they have been to rock concerts without me too. I just feel I am no longer a part of the group.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I feel how this is hurting you. The best thing would be to talk to them about feeling disinvited to group activities. Let them know you are still free and really want to spend some time together. Do you think you can open up to them on whats bothering you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I don't know. I don't want to come across as just being paranoid or whiny. Sometimes I think it would be better to just forget them and not have any friends.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It sounds like this situation is really bothering you. Its hard and overwhelming to feel isolated. The bonds of friendship are worth the confrontation. If they don't know what is bothering you, it will be harder to mend the relationship.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It is making me really depressed and is badly damaging my sense of self worth. I feel as though I am not worth anyone's time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You are worth every precious second of time and should not let this diminish your self worth. Find common ground, an activity you all enjoy and invite them to hang with you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you that is helpful. What if I reach out and they all snub me though?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: We all have busy hectic lives at time. True friends make time to be with one another. This world is full of beautiful people to bond with. Keeping a closed circle of friends is a blessing.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It's not really so much that my life is hectic. On the contrary, sometimes it feels as though it is rather empty and not having the support of friends does not help with that.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Anyway I do appreciate your help - you have given me things to think about.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I hear how this is making you sad not feeling supported in the way that you need to be. Know that you are worthy and will find a way to connect with them. I hope this has helped.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It has .. thank you very much and enjoy your day!

seeker_question1: There is a time lag though I do not know whose end it was on.
supporter_question1: I wanted to help more. Be a light for them.
supporter_question2: Can we have the option to minimize the instructions so the chat is bigger?

situation: It is the anniversary of my fiance's death.  I am having extreme depression and saddness.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi. I am looking for support for depression.  My fiance died four years ago today and I am very sad.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am sorry to hear about your loss. How do you feel throughout the day?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Very sad.  I think about him often.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It is sad indeed having a loved one past. Having time will help.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes but how much time?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Some takes weeks. Others take month or years. It's different for everyone. I know where you are coming from. I lost my husband a couple years ago and it took me awhile to move on as well.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm so sorry.  It is very hard, isn't it?  I know time is helping, but sometimes, like today, it's just overwhelming how much I miss him.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think perhaps you could think of the wonderful times that you spent with your fiance, and cherish those feelings.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, I do try.  Thank you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: May I ask what helped you move forward?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I thought of the good times that we spent together. What are some of your happy memories with your fiance?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Some of my favorites are playing games together or watching movies.  Curling up on the couch. He had kidney failure, so we didn't do much outside, but spent as much time together as we could. He used to call me his sunshiney baby doll.  Whenever I see sunflowers I think of him.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But most of all, it was that he loved me.  He loved me for me ... he didn't want me to be anyone or anything else. That was a miracle.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is so sweet. How are you feeling now with all these memories coming back to you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: actually i am feeling somewhat better.  still sad, but it's good to remember those things.  thank you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i appreciate your time and understanding.  I hope you are able to remember your good times as well.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Other ways to cope is perhaps taking a new hobby. Do you have any new interest that you would like to try? I took up a cooking class a few months after my husband past away, and I really enjoyed it.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i've been trying to figure out a hobby ... but i haven't really found anything that appeals to me.  a cooking class sounds interesting though. i might learn how to do things in the kitchen without injuring myself.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I tend to be clumsy at the best of times and have done things such as (most recently) dropping a scalding bowl of chili on my foot.  I tend to wait to do new things til the last injury heals.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think you will do fine in the kitchen once you get the hang of it. What are some of your favorite food?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: hmmm.  i love tacos.  and stews.  cheesecake.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: i used to bake ... but i'm diabetic so that's probably not such a good idea any more.  and since we're working at home now i can't bake and take it into the office for people to enjoy

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes, I enjoy tacos and cheesecake as well, especially from the Cheesecake Factory.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: oh my yes, the Cheesecake Factory has amazing cheesecake.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am going to go now. Thank you very much for your support. It helps to have an "ear" ... just to be able to talk about it and be reminded that it's all going to be okay.  Plus, that there's cheesecake in the world, so it can't all be bad, right?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Okay, I'm glad you are feeling better. Enjoy the rest of your day and stay safe.

seeker_question1: It started a little slow and awkward, but it smoothed out.

situation: I have lost my job, and my entire industry has been shut down due to Covid-19, and I am struggling to find work that is safe for me to do from home.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hey, how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Not the best, but I'm surviving.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: hello?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content:
By surviving, it is more of a personal situation
 or an outside dilemma affecting you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: is it*

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just haven't been able to find any work. I guess that is an outside dilemma, but being this behind on bills and feeling this helpless to change my situation has negatively impacted my mood.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I see what you mean. Finding work in this environment can be stressful as well. In any case, I can say that a good way to start is to account for all transactions you make.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have already been budgeting extensively, the issue is I can't make enough to cover my basic expenses, no matter how much I cut them

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Are you also pressed for time? Time management can be a predicament as well.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have lots of free time, just waiting for unemployment to respond to my claims, applying for jobs online, and trying services like mturk to earn what I can from home in the meantime.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I spend a good portion of my day trying to apply for everything I can and fixating on mturk tasks to make me feel like I'm accomplishing something

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Wow, it's slightly uncanny the way our situations are similar. For someone who is also not in the best place financially and just making the bare minimum, it can feel hopeless sometimes.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I know you are feeling stressed at the moment, but I've realized focusing on the long term helps ease the pressure of current stressors.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I get to a point in my day where it feels like I've done everything I can for that day, and then I just have to try not to get too stir crazy.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I feel that if you can focus on using your extra time as an investment into yourself (whether by reading, picking up a hobby, or working out), you can feel more accomplished and at ease with what you are doing in life.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I've been trying to look ahead, but this year has already set me back so much from my intended career path that it's frustrating. I just want my life back.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That is good advice. I have been doing a lot more art during this time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Being progressive is difficult, but is one of the things in life which compound very easily. I believe many aspects in life are connected and that improving in some parts improves you as a whole

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Some days it's tempting to just do nothing and wait for it all to be over, but I feel better when I accomplish something for the day

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: And if these "improvements" can also make you money/increase your worth/ease your mind, then that can be called a success. In my opinion atleast.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I wish someone was interested in buying my art! That would be a huge confidence boost

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yeah, but imagine how it would if you had days like that knowing it isn't a bad thing to relax. You have already put in the work in being comfortable before, allowing to enjoy your time however way you wanted.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Looks like you already have an interest which can help you in many ways in life. That's really good.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes, I miss being able to actually relax. When you are financially behind it feels like everything is just making it worse.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thank you for chatting with me and helping me earn the bonus for this task!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes, the tension and pressure only seems to mount on, but there will always be things like that in life. It is important to remember whether such problems are in your control or not. If they are, you know for sure that you can change how you are presently.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: No problem, this is a very interesting experience for me too.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That sounds like a great idea! Remember to keep your friends close too. I know it can be tough when you feel as low as this, but it's important to have a good support system in addition to any therapy you might be receiving.

dialog.speaker: supporter

Remember to keep your friends close and to start looking for a new therapist if you haven't already. If you find one that's not the right fit it doesn't hurt to start over or maybe even ask for a recommendation from that therapist. If they're any good they should understand how important it is for you to find a good fit. Also remember to be kind to yourself. It can be difficult, but I know you can do it.

I'm ok! I got my friends and family. I made an appointment with my psychiatrist to get different medication so I could ask him for a therapist recommen
dation as well.

situation: Having a lot going on in life and school and feeling very stressed.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello, how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have been better. I am really stressed and feel like I am at a breaking point.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am sorry to hear you are near your breaking point, do you have any idea when the decline and stress began?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It began a few weeks ago. I have had a really intense project that is on a time crunch. I feel like I am overwhelmed and unable to balance work and personal life.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Work and personal life are very hard to juggle with each other, especially in the current life situations around the globe.  I am sure you will successfully handle both in the overall.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: What should I do to help feel like I can manage and push through? Right no w i feel like giving up.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content:
For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to "debrief" my mind, and "declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex
perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content:
Sometimes, something as small as an 
accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. Overall its hard to juggle all things I want to do and be at once. I will plan to make a list and check off some small things.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content:
When you visually see your success, I hope it will help like it does for myself. I personally believe that it is a useful tool, depression runs deep and anxiety pushes it over the edge with deadlines. Life and Personal are very complicated situations. As is living, in itself. Small accomplishments, maybe with minor rewards to
 yourself as you go, boosts confidence and tends to fade out the overwhelming heavy feelings.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: What do you consider to be a minor reward that would be a good tool for me today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have created a list and was able to check one thing off already. This has helped some and I feel a little more relieved.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: A punch card. If you have one handy, a note card/index card. Draw maybe, 15 circles around the edge, and call it "My rewards" In the middle, choose one thing you enjoy, for instance, if you like an ice cream sundae, put that in the middle. For your first task, just jot all that is on your mind down, and also use that as the first task to yourself. Check off one circle, and once you hit 15 get that sundae!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Awesome! I am happy to hear that it has already helped a little!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thats a great idea. I really like that!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I do sincerely hope you start feeling better, the current average life has altered greatly, and it has changed workloads and balances with great challenges.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes. We are all being challenged and perhaps this will help people grow. I know that once i an over the hump I will be happy i did it and put in the effort. I appreciate the in the moment help!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Absolutely, I appreciate the chance to speak with you and give suggestions.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Do you have nay other tips that i may use?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Perhaps, nature. A walk alone somewhere pretty tends to be a refreshing, zen-like activity. Or even, as a meditation type approach, rock stacking. It takes much focus, and tends to leave your mind clearer in the end. I also recommend reading, or listening to audio books of a theme you are interested in. It brings comfort in activities

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thank you. It is sometimes hard to make time to do those things. I think i will try and scheduled them into my dat
