situation: I just had a baby and im struggling with my physical appearance and my mental health.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: hey

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello, my name is Amber, how are you doing?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I could be better.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What's been happening?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just had a baby 2 months ago and I have been struggling with my physical appearance and dealing with my mental health.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is part of that the weight gain from pregnancy?   And what sort of mental health challenges are you having?   Both of these problems are very common for new mothers.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm sorry to hear you are going through this, it sounds like a very tough time for you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I didnt keep much weight from the pregnancy but its the loose skin that makes it very challenging to accept and to love my self.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh that is understandable.   I am a mother, and remember worrying about the same thing.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My depression has gotten worse since having my son. I feel a constant feeling that i'm not a good mother. I feel worthless and having a constant feeling that I don't deserve my son

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can tell you from personal experience that loose skin, stretch marks, and loosening of "other parts" do all self correct with time.  You will feel better about your body again when they do.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: How did you cope with post partum?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I was fortunate not to experience depresion.  But I totally went through self doubt, wondering if I was being a good enough mother, and feeling "not up to" the task....it's the hardest job in the world, being a mom, and so exhausting the first while.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you spoken to your doctor about how depressed you are feeling?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes. I mentioned it to them at my 6 week pp check up. I was prescribed to a med to help but I dont think its fully in its works yet.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Antidepressants can take a couple of weeks to kick in, I am on them too;  I hope you will find them helpful.   It's hard waiting for them to work!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you have someone helping you with the baby or are you a single mom?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: The best advice I can share from my experience as a new mom was find someone to give you breaks.   Whether that be a partner, a friend, a family member, or even a baby sitter if that's possible.   Its important to take time to rest and recharge an nurture yourself, whether that be a nap, a bubble bath, a walk or whatever has made you feel good in the past.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you, I hope so too. Yes I have my husband helping me. I am a stay at home mom while he goes to work. Im lucky that I am able to stay home with our son but at the same time its hard because because theres a less opportunity to have a break and on top of that he works 12 hour shifts so I rarley get to spend time with my husband.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I took my first break 2 days ago with my husband. We went on a day road trip and it felt really good to have that day to have together away from the baby but at the same time it was hard leaving our baby.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh that's a long shift...I'm glad you have someone at home to help when he can.   It may seem impossible but you are stronger than you think...you've got this

dialog.speaker: supporter

situation: I wish I had a girlfriend. I haven't seen any friends outside of my household since last October!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello. How are you? What would you like to talk about?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Got any advice for a lonely single fellow in his mid thirties? I miss my friends, and virtual meetings on Zoom don't feel the same as meeting in person!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: The pandemic has been hard on many people, those in relationships and those looking for new ones! Have you tried to develop a new hobby or interest that you can do with others once the pandemic is over?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, I've been writing enough poetry to publish a book, so I'll certainly do that. I know the pandemic has been rough for everyone. Hopefully my doctor will say I qualify for the vaccine soon.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Getting my stimulus check in the next week or so would certainly make me a bit happier, too.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's great! Poetry is something you can share in person or over video link. What about physical activities? I think that yoga might be something that you can do by yourself and with others. There are a bunch of videos on sites like YouTube.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: A stimulus check! Yes, we can all use money during these trying times.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Oh, I took advantage of virtual yoga and zumba early on during the pandemic. Friends had virtual classes. Eventually they were able to go back to work. Being disabled is a poverty trap for a lot of people, not just me. I really want to find a girlfriend once I get vaccinated.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have tried yoga myself, but it wasn't really my thing. I prefer walking and riding a bike.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you have to wait until you get vaccinated to start working on getting a girlfriend?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well, certain things don't work for every person.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: True. I like trying new things, but I am happy to give them up if they just don't fit my style.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is there a way you could start looking for a girlfriend online now, before the pandemic is over?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Maybe there is a way to make a connection using your poetry.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Technically, no, I don't HAVE to wait to get vaccinated, but then again, maybe I don't want a girlfriend. The only one I had ten years ago in college wanted to marry me and have a child and I wasn't ready for commitment. I fear marriage, actually.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Marriage is a big step, and any prudent person would think carefully before making the commitment.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's a good point, I'm sure if my poetry is entertaining or full of truth about my experiences in a wheelchair, perhaps a woman will find that attractive

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Are you concerned that things will move too quickly to that level of commitment (marriage)? You could make it clear from the outset that you want to take it slow.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Or I could just get an adult entertainer to be my companion for a day. I've done that before with women in that industry. It costs a bit, but it's worth it for companionship

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I just hate the idea of waking up to one woman for 20 or 30 years

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But it's better than being alone

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Robin Williams talked about that situation.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: He said that he didn't fear being alone as much as being with people that he didn't like.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Did he really? Well, it's sad how he ended up, I'm too scared to commit suicide like he did! I enjoy living life, even when I have months at a time without human connection

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Adult entertainers provide one kind of companionship, but it is not complete. It feels like a stopgap to me. Is it fulfilling enough for you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You're right, I just lack self confidence in my poetry....hopefully I'll figure out a way to spit it out on a blog or something

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You could trade poems with other budding poets. "I'll show you mine if you show me yours."

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you find yourself to be more an introvert or an extrovert?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Oh it's been very fulfilling for me when I've had the opportunity to use it. Most of them are genuine women. Only a handful have tried to take advantage of me.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm definitely an extrovert

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That was a clever pun by the way

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It's ironic and strange how many people struggle with that stupid voice in their head that tells them they're not good enough to accomplish anything.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Thanks. Ok. The pandemic is particularly hard on extroverts. People look down on sex workers, but I think that the world is a big complex place and people are trying to make their way in it. If everyone is consenting, I see no problem.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you tried psilocybin? Some people swear that it changes the inner monologue for the better. I am not a physician, but for long-term adjustment, it might be beneficial.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Well of course it's consentual. I would never NOT ask for permission to do things with a sex worker, or any person.

dialog.content: At this point, you will have to ask your family to make time to talk with you and im sure they will understand if they hear where you are coming from

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.content: I've always been closer to my mom so she is much more understanding. She helps me pay my monthly bills too.

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.content: No, I am too far away to stop by or go for the weekend. I would have to plan a whole trip and I cant really afford it yet. My brother knew that the pets were mine but he demanded that he keep them there and I didnt want to fight with him so I said fine.

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker

He would also pull pranks on me that were just cruel. He once told me that my cat was ran over but he was just hiding her at a friends house for a week.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yeah, he doesn't seem very nice, but its good that you don't retaliate negatively

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Special talents to showcase

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.speaker: supporter

dialog.content:
Try not to lose hope.

Perhaps you could find one of those organizations locally to help you through this.  Also, since they would be local, they might have more information about legal remedies you could pursue.  Some of your ex's behavior sounds criminal...

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: My suggestion is to focus on new hobbies, spend time with friends and family when possible, if you have work you can do in the mean time, if you like to exercise or go outside, all of this is a helpful tool.

dialog.content: Don't be afraid to express your feelings and confide in others about your emotions and mental health. It is still a loss and something you should feel comfortable grieving.
